content.raw:
I'm trying this out in the lab right now and have a question: Is there any
particular reason this only works when the user_devices folder specified is
in userlib? I've typically kept our lab devices repo at the labscript_suite
level (which I'm fine to change if need be) and when I try using this
change from there I get double import denier errors.
content.html: I'm trying this out in the lab right now and have a question: Is there any particular reason this only works when the user_devices folder specified is in userlib? I've typically kept our lab devices repo at the labscript_suite level (which I'm fine to change if need be) and when I try using this change from there I get double import denier errors.

content.raw:
Correction: I'm only getting double import errors because I have put some
labscript basic type subclasses in the user_devices top level `__init__.py`
file. If I import devices from user_devices before that import all is good.
If I import after, the double import denier gets me. Do I have to move
those definitions to their own submodule?
content.html: Correction: I'm only getting double import errors because I have put some labscript basic type subclasses in the user_devices top level __init__.py file. If I import devices from user_devices before that import all is good. If I import after, the double import denier gets me. Do I have to move those definitions to their own submodule?

content.raw:
OK, so I figured this out after finally understanding the code. I had
assumed that the labconfig wanted the user_devices keyword defined with a
fully qualified path. Changing it to just the module name puts everything
right. I've also confirmed that the module can be in userlib or the
labscript_suite directory as well.

Anyway, this is working for me. Feel free to merge whenever.
content.html:
OK, so I figured this out after finally understanding the code. I had assumed that the labconfig wanted the user_devices keyword defined with a fully qualified path. Changing it to just the module name puts everything right. I've also confirmed that the module can be in userlib or the labscript_suite directory as well.

Anyway, this is working for me. Feel free to merge whenever.

content.raw:
Sorry David, Bitbucket never gave me email notifications that you commented here, and I’m just seeing your comments now.

Correct, it has to be somewhere importable and you are expected to give the import path, not the filepath. Thanks for testing! Merging.
content.html:
Sorry David, Bitbucket never gave me email notifications that you commented here, and I’m just seeing your comments now.

Correct, it has to be somewhere importable and you are expected to give the import path, not the filepath. Thanks for testing! Merging.

content.raw: I was wondering why it was so quiet. Just assumed you were tied up in research.
